verses.roman:
antaḥ-pura-janaiḥ prītyā
mukundaḥ phulla-locanaiḥ
sa-sambhramair abhyupetaḥ
prāviśad rāja-mandiram

synonyms: antaḥ-pura—of the imperial precinct; janaiḥ—by the people; prītyā—lovingly; mukundaḥ—Lord Kṛṣṇa; phulla—blossoming; locanaiḥ—whose eyes; sa-sambhramaiḥ—in a flurry; abhyupetaḥ—approached with greetings; prāviśat—He entered; rāja—royal; mandiram—the palace.
translation: With wide-open eyes, the members of the royal household came forward in a flurry to lovingly greet Lord Mukunda, and thus the Lord entered the royal palace.
